SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.tui

Interface Prompt

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasePrompt, ChoicePrompt, InputPrompt
public interface Prompt
Textual prompt which can be displayed to the player, which can then answer it.

This is the main way the TUI can request input from the player.

See Also:
  • TuiRenderer.setPrompt(Prompt)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    Prompt.ActionContext
    Context object which is passed to Prompt actions to aid them in constructing and returning a valid result type.
    static interface 
    Prompt.Factory
    Factory which creates prompts
    static interface 
    Prompt.InvalidResult
    Result type which has an optional error message Only results of type Prompt.ResultType.INVALID, Prompt.ResultType.PROMPT and Prompt.ResultType.SUBPROMPT can be safely casted to this type.
    static interface 
    Prompt.PromptResult
    Result type which has a newly attached prompt and optionally an error message Only results of type Prompt.ResultType.PROMPT and Prompt.ResultType.SUBPROMPT can be safely cast to this type.
    static interface 
    Prompt.Result
    Result of the invocation of handleChoice(TuiRenderer, String)
    static enum 
    Prompt.ResultType
    Type of possible results returned by handleChoice(TuiRenderer, String)

    Description
    static final Prompt.Factory
    ROOT_PROMPT_FACTORY
    Prompt factory which creates prompts without any parent (so-called "root" prompts)

  • Field Details

    • ROOT_PROMPT_FACTORY

      static final Prompt.Factory ROOT_PROMPT_FACTORY
      Prompt factory which creates prompts without any parent (so-called "root" prompts)

  • Method Details

    • getParent

      @Nullable @Nullable Prompt getParent()
      Returns the parent prompt of this prompt, or null if this is a root prompt

    • getText

      String getText()
      Returns the request text of this prompt to show to the user

    • getChoices

      @Unmodifiable List<String> getChoices()
      Returns indications about the possible options (if any) the user can choose

    • handleChoice

      Prompt.Result handleChoice(TuiRenderer renderer, String input)
      Tries to solve/advance this prompt with the given input
      Parameters:
      renderer - renderer where this prompt is being invoked onto
      input - user-provided input to answer this prompt
      Returns:
      a result type based on whether the provided user input has satisfied the request, needs further info with other prompts, or was invalid
      See Also:
      • Prompt.ActionContext
